page.title: 20Gelliwion Forestry
page.content: The first tree was planted in Gelliwion forestry in 1955.The conifer trees growing are the Douglas Fir and the Western Fir,which grow in bracken soil,and the Scots Pine and the Norway Spruce,which grow in mineral soil(the mineral here being the coal in the old coal tip).Around the edge,the Larch grows in the stony soil and this tree turns brown in Winter.The birds found in the forestry include the Crows and Magpies at the foot of the forest,the woodpeckers among the larches,the wood pidgeon and the owl,and at the top of the forest the Gold Crest.The animals include field mice,grey squirrels, foxes,stoats and badgers.The first pair of badgers were brought from West Wales.Adders are also found.The forest workers made a paved walk-Martins Walk -which leads to a pond and picnic area.(Angela Jones-Hafod school)
